CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 13, 1957, pg. 1, reads: "Miller St. Group Protests - Principal John M. Brewer of Miller Street School, second from right on far side of table, tells City Council about his 13-month fight to have a lot, opposite Miller School, which is unsightly and dangerous to children, cleaned up by the City, County, and School Board, who jointly own it. During that time, 18 children have been hurt on the lot.  Seated next to Principal Brewer, on the immediate left, are Mrs. Jane Giles, representative to Hill District Community Council, and beside Mrs. Giles, to her left, is Mrs. Marie Thomas, president of the Miller St. School P. TA. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men, including Marie Thomas, Jane Giles, and John M. Brewer seated around table in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers, City County Building
